description: Needed a burrito for lunch and this spot was nearby. I always love these little family run burrito joints. This one was excellent I'd say! I ordered the super veggie burrito and added their green sauce from the salsa bar and watched some fútbol on the TV they have. Stellar experience to say the least!
author: Andrew U.

description:
I had a HORRIBLE experience at this restaurant tonight.  It was a customer service issue and RACIALLY MOTIVATED.  The workers assumed I didn't speak Spanish or understand Spanish because they proceeded to say things I don't think they would have said if they knew I could understand them.  2 MALE EMPLOYEES AND IM FEMALE - THEY SAID VERY IN-APPROPRIATE THINGS, that I will not lower myself to repeat online in a public forum.  If you're female and have had the same experience at this restaurant ... PLEASE POST COMMENTS AND SAY WHEN AND WHAT CONTEXT SO MAYBE THE MANAGEMENT WILL FIX THE PROBLEM. I'm positive this was not an isolated incident. I'm sure it's happened before and will again!  

I WILL NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE AGAIN!!!
author: Donna R.

description:
I got a carne asada super burrito to go. The whole thing was soggy. The burrito was falling apart and spilling all over I couldn't eat more than 3 bites. The lettuce also tasted old and expired. I highly do not recommend this place for burritos. The other stuff may be ok.

Pretty disappointing overall. And I went at 8pm so I shouldn't have expected it that bad at that time.
author: Kalani R.

description: Best burritos ever! This is my go-to Mexican spot. Hidden gem in Lower Haight. Food is great, staff is friendly. Amazing little restaurant!
author: Ellison M.

description:
Does a place deserve a bump in ratings because they now have a single item that you think is great while the rest of the menu is not-so?

Recently they started serving lengua as a meat option. I haven't been to a competing taqueria in the vicinity since. I grab lengua tacos from here at least every other week, which is very frequent for me. Most of the time they leave the lengua on the plancha until the edges get crispy. The tacos are unreasonably loaded with meat. 

After living in the area for a couple years, they may have won me over.
author: Huey N.

description: This is legitimately the worst Mexican food I've ever had. I ordered it to go and i got the 3 tacos and it asks what you want on the first taco and I said meat and then the next two automatically come with large chunks of tofu...weird. Then my bf got the chili relleno which had more seeds than anything else. It ended up being inedible. I don't really leave bad reviews but I couldn't not. Definitely skip this place if you're considering getting it
author: Amanda L.

description: I usually don't write reviews but I just need to write a warning. I had ordered delivery and there was a fly (and it was still alive) in my food. I made the mistake of ordering without checking the reviews because I was so hungry. I had already killed it and disposed of the fly before I thought of taking a picture as proof. Now this may be a one time situation but I don't feel comfortable to give it another try..
author: Nora R.

description: I eat at various taquerias in San Francisco. This one happened to be close to me when I finished work last night. I dont like leaving negative reviews and I am not a picky eater but I swear that was the least satisfying  burrito I have had in a long long time. I wont ever go back when there is a plethora of good food in the city. Avocado instead of guac and no sour cream in my super burrito either. Flavor very meh. Sorry guys.
author: Chris R.

description: I really just wanted to order a burrito without the surprise chicken bone and the giant avocado peel, but alas, my meal came with all the fixings.
author: Nikki O.

description: I wish I could give this place a higher rating. I order the super quesadilla (chicken) for lunch and what I got was something so weird. First the quesadilla was super wet and I had entire chicken breast just placed in the quesadilla. Just to be clear the chicken breast was whole, not cubed or shredded. Taste was poor. I generally like to try a place more then once before I review, but I don't want to wastey money again. Give the place a try. Maybe my item was a unique and unfortunate event.
author: David O.

description:
I've lived down the street from Estrella for 5+ years. It was always bad fake Mex, but now its REAL bad REAL fake Mex. If you're waisted and need something, go for it. If you actually enjoy Mexican food try El Castillo a block away and you'll be so glad you read this. Specific meals:
Nachos are probably as good as their food gets
The "guacamole" is a gross watered down avo salsa - skip it
Steak is better than the chicken

I honestly don't know how they stay open while good restaurants keep hitting the dust...
author: Corinne A.

description:
They lost the first star on price. Maybe if the food was extra big to cover the extra cost, but no. 

Then the food was okay, just okay.

But here's the real kicker: I was paying for an order when I put my phone down and it was immediately stolen. Brand new phone gone in 2 seconds. All I asked of the employee, whom I tipped well, was "Can you point me north". "How do I get to Van Ness?" He considered me and asked "You want directions?" "Yes please" I said.

"No." He replied. Just no. I asked once more "Really? You can't give me directions." "No." Again. Not one word of "Sorry your phone was taken" or "Can you call the police for you since you can't? Or someone to come pick you up?" Not even "Did you like your food". Just "No."
author: Julian S.

description: My husband just got some food from here. It was a complete mistake . The food was the most horrible thing we ever ate in our lives. We spent $30 something and totally wasted our money. The chicken flautas was bland and soggy like it was frozen and then microwaved. The burritos was nasty and had no taste. We couldn't eat it. Had to throw it away. If we weren't so tired from our day, we would go back there and ask for a refund! This place deserves a zero star. I'm not sure why they are still in business. Horrible, I feel like we're about to get food poisoning.
author: Chance D.

description:
Such awful service!!!

I get the same order every time and charged different amounts each time I'm here. 
I began sending receipts to my email and when I showed them to the manager this time - what they were charging changes every time I'm here - no action was taken. 

No accountability, no apology at all..
author: Val K.

description:
Nothing stood out about this place at all except the lack of cleanliness. They leave a bus tub on the trash can so you can throw away your trash and place your dished inside the tub. Not everyone in this world is a grown up and cleans up after themselves. Not once during my 45 minutes there did someone come out and clean/wipe off tables for newly arriving customers. I had to wipe beans and rice off my chair before sitting. 
The super burrito was a decent size but not the quality of a near $10 burrito. The chicken lacked any and all flavor. The salsas at the salsa bar were just horrible, runny, watery texture with no flavor. Go inside and look behind the counter, the place looks so dirty. The guy working the counter acted like a total ass to all 8 of us so be sure you tell whoever is cooking that day (it was all ladies when I was in) what you want first then side step left to pay otherwise he'll tell you in a condescending tone. 
It'd be easier to make a sign. Won't be back based on cleanliness and food quality.
author: Michael S.

description: Wow, Uber eats with these guys. Absolutely painful experience. Took over an hour for bean and cheese burrito.
author: Cole A.

description: Wow. Worst chicken in green sauce burrito. Flavorless even with extra salsa. How can you make flavorless salsa?! Gross. My boyfriend got the spicy chicken burrito, took 6 bites and couldn't finish it.
author: Krista M.

description:
Solid service, approachable food, late night burritos are great. 

Pro tip: ask for quesadillas extra crispy. And they'll add jalapeños if you're kind.

We need more places like this. 
Order from the grill and watch them chop your protein before grilling it with fresh vegetables. 
Just talk to them and be real, be jovial.

My food is always wonderful. 
Once they charged me too much on accident and immediately gave me the cash difference. They're just great people. 

Eat here and just...be cool.
author: Tyler K.

description: Ordered here through Postmates and received absolutely horrible food. Not fresh with old salad and a horribly foul odour! Do not go!
author: Frank M.

description: Ordered delivery from here and got food with visible mold on it that smelled of freezer burn.
author: Christopher B.

description:
This place has a lot of bad reviews for poor delivery service.  Well - I am not sure about you but I like my Mexican food hot and fresh so I wouldn't really think about ordering delivery. Get off your toosh and walk over to this spot to put in your order. Or, in my case, have too many beers next door at Toronado and stumble in to demolish some food.

Estrella Taqueria has a great vegetarian menu (something you don't find too often in the area) as well as choice of 4 different kinds of tortillas (flour, whole wheat, spinach or tomato).  I went for a veggie 'bowl' (no tortilla) with black beans, rice, grilled veggies, tofu and pico de gallo.  The service was super friendly and the guy even cooked up some veggie on the spot for me as they didn't have any prepped.  He explained the beans weren't cooked in lard (seems this has changed from the past) so great for vegans/vegetarians.  I also went for a side of chips and guac and loaded up on the spicy salsa for the serve yourself salsa bar in the corner.  The veggies, tofu and beans were okay a little bland so I added some hot sauce to kick it up a notch.  The guac was really disappointing.  Somehow super watery and no flavor at all (gimme some salt!), maybe they over mixed it or it was made in the morning and just not fresh by the time I got it around 7PM at night but this place does not do guac justice! agh!

Anyway.  In all I would say don't do delivery from here (based on the other reviews for long waits) don't get the guac, but come here for a decent and cheap Mexican food option on the lower haight.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Got bad food poisoning from the Tofu Ranchero burrito. A veggie burrito gave me food poisoning, that's pretty hard to do. Made me miss out on a whole day of my vacation. Boo!
author: Jessica V.

description: Definitely a solid late night burrito, satisfies my late night cravings perfectly. Would recommend the California burrito.
author: Caelin J.

description: I love specific things here.pollo asada plate, chicken soup...just chicke,potato,zucchini, and crispy tacos...they come on threes...I go carniitas, Pollo asasda, and chicken mole. All bean choices are vegan,salsas are good...family managed...great service and fresh if you order off the grill and not the steam table. Huge portions. Nice people.
author: Christina M.

description: Awful. Do not order delivery from here. Got a prawn quesadilla and a breakfast burrito. I don't know how they can list a "prawn" quesadilla on their menu when you get 4 small shrimp inside a tortilla that's bigger than my face. At first glance I could have sworn they gave me a cheese only quesadilla. For $8.75 it's so not worth it. Also my quesadilla said it included salsa so I asked for it on the side and of course I didn't get it. But they were nice enough to include a small bag of complimentary chips so I could eat them with the salsa I didn't receive. Lame. Go elsewhere
author: Isabel O.

description:
If one of my family members from the Midwest came into town and said "I would really like Mexican food, but I don't want it to have any spice or much flavor." I now know where to take them. 
I ordered super nachos. And they are ok. My bad for ordering nachos for delivery, but the lack of flavor isn't. And asked for extra salsas on the side, I didn't get any.
I ordered chips and salsa, and asked for that to be spicy. I think it must be a roasted poblano salsa, there is noooooo spice anywhere in this container. 

Super disappointed.
author: Kaileigh B.

description: Ordered the 3 crispy tacos with beef. Don't recommend them. They had no flavor and they make them using pre made taco shells instead of frying them fresh which was a huge negative for me.
author: Victoria D.

description:
My rating is solely based on having Delivery service. They were true to their ETA time, the food was good. 
I enjoyed the super burrito, my lesson was to get retried beans instead of whole black or pinto. Then it'll be too moist and soggy. 
The bag of chips that was provided were a little over fried. Other than that it was all good.
Good salsas 
My friend enjoyed the nachos over his prawn burrito, don't know what that was about.
author: Gabriel M.

description:
These guys are so nice, and their food is bomb.  They are always friendly and don't mind if you post up to do some homework at one of the tables.  I'd definitely recommend to anyone in lower haight looking for a nice dining room to sit down and get some free wifi.  My one complaint is sometimes the food can come out a little cold, but it's only happened once, so this review is staying five stars!  

Great job, you all.  And thanks for making me feel so welcome!
author: Jay D.

description: One of the better Burritos I had in SF. Several beans options, solid size and quick service.
author: Mark J.

description: I was heading over to Rosemunde for a nice sausage. The line was long and my patience was short so I walked into Estrella. This will work, I thought. Was I wrong! I write this review from the downstairs toilet at my office. *you never poop upstairs, it's the unspoken rule. Anywho, my ass if fucking lit! I brought my burrito over to Noc Noc and as I got about 1/4 of the way into that thick piece I felt my mouth burning. That hateful taqueria chef put 6 red chili peppers in that burrito. Full peppers. Like in dumb and dumber. Im the only dumb one here though. I've made this mistake with Estrella one too many times. Who knows when I'll finally leave this downstairs bathroom but daddy has work to do and no time for this!
author: Rick V.

description: I ordered a super burrito for delivery from here last night. As I was eating it, I bit down on something hard. I pulled it out of the burrito, and it was a whole piece of chicken that had not be shredded or taken off the bone. That's not supposed to be in a burrito and is very hazardous. Also, the burrito itself was flavorless. This is the 2nd time I have ordered from them, and I remember the 1st time the food was not that great then either. I won't be ordering from here again.
author: Jasmine E.

description:
Cheap and cheerful! 4 stars, + 1 as noted below.
Hey I think this place is just great and deserves higher ratings. It's a straightforward basic taqueria, what more do you want? Does it need tablecloths and fancy decor to be noticed? Does it require some kind of new SF hipster reinterpretation to be legit? Perhaps some pork belly. Korean fusion tacos? PBR? NO!

It's straight forward, easy. I like the food just fine and the location can't be beat. They're really nice too. 

Plus--It's triply awesome that they will actually deliver a burrito (with ranchero enchilada sauce of course!) right up to my house. So the EXTRA star is for that convenience and joy!
author: Rachel D.

description: Worst tacos I've ever had. Got the carnitas and carne asada and they were mostly fat and super greasy, like they'd been sitting out for a while. Inside of the restaurant is dirty, worn down, and dim.
author: Jenn H.

description:
There was a reason why this place was completely empty on a Saturday night. I ordered a fish taco, took one bite 
When I attempted to exchange it for a lower priced item, the cashier said, " well you already at it." Sorry, after taking one bite and you realize you are being sold last months fish at $5.00 a taco. Come on! Shut this place down!
author: Alyson H.

description:
My review is based on Eat24 delivery, and I never write reviews, especially bad ones, but my experience tonight was so bad that I feel the need to share.  

I've ordered from Estrella Taqueria in the past, and I could not believe all the negative reviews, as they were good a few years ago.  So I thought I'd give them another try.

I ordered on Sunday at 6:31pm and they quoted me 60-90 minutes for delivery, which is fine, I guess for a rainy Sunday night.  The delivery driver calls me on my cell phone at 8:03pm (92 minutes) saying "food delivery here".  I ask him to ring the buzzer so I can buzz him into the building.  No buzzer.  I wait a minute and still no buzzer.  I decide to walk down the stairs and check on him and he finally gets out of the car and hands me the food at my front door.  Doesn't say a single word to me.  Not even a 'thank you'.  The look on his face said the complete opposite of "thank you", he glared at me with the most hateful eyes...

The food matched the service.   Everything came cold, as expected.  The carne asada plate for $11 yielded two extremely thin (like 3 envelopes stacked together thin) slices of chewy beef, wilted lettuce, beans, rice, and blackening guacamole.  The crispy tacos were now soggy, and the bits that were not soggy were very stale.  The Super Burrito was cold and the meat overcooked.  

I spent $51.21 tonight, hoping and praying it would be good.  It was not and I will never order from Estrella Taqueria again.
author: Curtis C.

description:
Not sure about how it's like to eat at the restaurant, but DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY from this place. I ordered meals for three people and gave a very high tip, but the place never delivered. I called them three times to see when it would come and just gave up after the order was AN HOUR late. That means it was 90 mins PLUS an hour late. Each time they told me that it would arrive in ten minutes, and I waited. It never came and they never let me know that it wasn't going to come. Don't order delivery, it's not worth it.

EDIT: I called Eat24 to get a refund and they told me that other customers had the same problem with this restaurant. Don't order delivery.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Absolutely amazing! They have several bean options to choose from
That are all vegetarian as well as their rice! They've also been very friendly every time I've gone which makes this place my favorite taqueria in NorCal.
author: Hannah L.

description: I have no idea how this is Mexican food.  Got it to go and only walked a block to the house.  Once opened upon arrival, we found the food to be soggy and salty.  Everything turned to be a mess.  The quesadilla and flautas was disgusting.  The burrito was ok, but nothing to even mention.  I do not plan to go back here again.  The burrito, quesadilla, and 2 al carte flautas cost $25!  Such a waste.
author: Anh N.

description:
Two hours ago I ordered a regular veggie burrito and upon getting home and taking a couple of bites, found a looooong, nasty hair. Gross, GROSS!! I won't be coming back. You employees need to pay more attention to what you're serving. 

Hace dos horas pedí un burrito vegetariano y después de unas mordidas encontré un pelo largo. ¡Que asqueroso! Yo nunca jamás voy a volver. Los empleados tienen que poner más atención a lo que hacen.
author: Lev B.

description: Hidden little gem.  Seems to be family owed and operated.  So attentive service.  The food here was delicious.  I had the mole' as a taco.  Great!!  My friend had the Alambre.  It was basically a carne asada plate which was made fresh when ordered.  Really bad cut of meat is used so it had way too much un edible pieces. I'd steer clear of the "alambre".  Did not try anything else so I will not come t on them.   The portions I saw were generous and the cook area was really neatly kept.
author: Jose R.

description:
I ordered delivery from Estrella Taqueria last night, and it was excellent. 
First of all, it is so difficult to find Mexican food that delivers. That alone makes me a customer :)
Second, the guacamole was good. It seems that if you have a go-to Mexican place with good Guacamole, all is not lost in life.
Third, the people were so nice. Very courteous and wanting to be sure my order was correct. 
Last, it was totally affordable. Affordable delivery in San Francisco? Si senorita.

We ordered burritos, a quesadilla, and guacamole, and ended up stoked. 

Thanks Estrella Taqueria! I'm a customer.
author: Anastasia B.

description:
I have been coming here for my Mexican food cravings for years. It's certainly not the best in San Francisco, but it's close to home and hits the spot when I'm in the mood for a burrito. I felt like I needed to write a review to defend it in response to a lot of the high maintenance one-star reviews. I've read so many ridiculous complaints about this place. (I can't speak to their online ordering complaints though, of which there seem to be quite a lot.)

I feel like it follows a model similar to the taquerias in the Mission, except it's not in the Mission, and that confuses and disturbs people who wandered in from Hayes Valley or the Marina who were expecting something more like Tacolicious or Little Chihuahua.

The cook asks you what you want in your burrito like they don't know what goes in a burrito? That's the way most taquerias operate. Even Chipotle does that. Go to Chevys if you can't be bothered. You couldn't exchange your food for something else after you started eating it? What restaurant does that? It's not a sweater that ended up not fitting right.

The food is fast and they assemble with practiced precision. They prepare it right in front of you and let you choose the ingredients, so I am not sure how other people have gotten their orders wrong or claim that the meat is microwaved. The produce has always looked fresh and vibrant. The food has always been really tasty and filling, though I agree with the reviewers that said their burritos tend to be wetter. I am not sure if it's because the produce is wet or the amount of salsa or what. I would also agree that it's not a place to go to for the decor and the ambiance. You can figure that out within seconds of stepping inside.

This is not the best place in SF for Mexican food. I would definitely pick a place in the Mission for that. But for taqueria style Mexican food in the Lower Haight, this place has always satisfied my cravings.
author: Trish B.

description: Super Nachos was not fulfilling... small portion imo
author: T K.

description: Yummy delivery.  Had DoorDash get a chorizo breakfast burrito and a combo plate of the enchilada, flauta and chili relleno.  Good portions, good prices and definitely that melty cheesy goodness you expect from a joint like this.
author: Aletta A.

description: I had a horrible experience with this restaurant. I should have known better because they barely have more than 2 stars. Ordered from eat24 at 4pm....by 7pm the order was still nowhere to be found. It took talking to their support team before I got a call from the driver who told me the food would be cold at arrival. I don't even want to go on to explain how rude the restaurant was to me when I called to see if everything was okay. Customer Service -0%. After waiting for 3 hours, they told me I was going to get cold food and had no problem telling me that. I was very taken aback. I can't believe that anyone in the service industry would treat their customers that way. Never ever again.
author: Natalie F.

description: This is one of those places thats acceptable at 1:30am on a Saturday night after bar hopping, on any other occasion you wont be leaving happy. Ive been here once after bar hopping and it wasn't bad, the next time was brutal. The burritos are priced the same as any other place and the size is average. The taste is just not there, no freshness in the condiments, meats are dry and the burritos wrapping is subpar. Would only come here after 4-5 drinks.
author: Josue V.

description:
Ordered 3 super burritos for delivery.

I thought I had landed on some bone when my teeth hit something hard. Nope, I just bit into a chunk of PLASTIC in my burrito. 

Could not eat another bite.

Will not be coming back.
author: Nicolai S.

description:
I'm baffled by the poor reviews, honestly. There is just no pleasing some people. 

Had the hard shell tacos and loved every bite. My buddy said he thought the quesadilla (recommended by the cook) was the best he's ever had. I had a bite and have to agree it was delicious. I'll be happy to give Estrella 5 stars, and will be back here again soon after a few brews at Toronado. Good prices good food friendly staff.
author: chris k.

description: The place is local and I've given it a chance a few times. Today was the worse. They short changed me and won't even deal with it. I bought a 7.00 breakfast burrito  paid with a 20.00 dollars. I received change for a 10.00 dollars. A place that cheats its customers is a place I won't go to. I also noticed a woman come out of the storage room and go right to the food and began handling it. Prices change constabtly as well as servers. As for the food it's not that great. Watch your money ...count your change..
author: Nathan J V.

description:
I picked up lunch here earlier today since I was in the Haight district.  Grabbed a super chicken burrito with hot sauce.  I was pretty underwhelmed though.   

I LOVE Mexican food,  so I have a sufficiently low bar for it to taste great. However,  these guys, unfortunately,  didn't clear even that bar!  I didn't think the burrito was that flavorful.

Also , my burrito wasn't wrapped very well which caused in to leak.  It was a messy.
author: Sebastian N.

description:
Please do not let the idea of delivery tacos make you as excited as it made me. You will become full of disappointment when your food actually arrives. 

Our meal actually arrived in a timely manner, however the contents of said meal was quite disappointing. The "crispy" tacos were anything but. So soggy all the innards fell out the bottom of the shell. Prawn tacos were mostly lettuce. The super taco means "please slop on as much guacamole and sour cream as humanly possible (because who wants to eat tacos with their hands anyways)." Speaking of sour cream - if you order the Super Nachos and ask for "sour cream on the side, please" this means you will get some chips with a SEA OF CREAM on top of them. Literally, the most sour cream I have ever seen on top of anything in my life. I'm talking an entire small tub of sour cream. Please, no.

When we called to get new nachos, made correctly, they told us we needed to call through GrubHub since we used them to order and that it would take and hour to get the new nachos. After talking to GrubHub, waiting about 30 minutes for a response, we are then told we can either get a refund for the nachos or wait an hour and a half - two hours to get a replacement. What? No. Just give me my money back, this is ridiculous.

So seriously, save yourself the trouble and do not get food from here. I can't say if it's any better if you actually go there in person, but just put "delivery tacos" on your list of things that are just too good to be true.
author: samantha g.

description:
OK, I have a love/hate relationship with Estrella Taqueria. It's extremely close to my house so I've gone quite a few times. The food is good as long as it's done right. You can get a pretty good burrito. You can get a pretty good quasadilla. However, don't get fancy! Their supreme-something-blah-blah quesadilla is gross. They put sour cream, guac, salsa, and other mystery liquids into the quesadilla before grilling it. It comes out a soggy, sticky, perplexing hot mess of a quesadilla. Just get a meat, cheese, and maybe veggies. 

Also, they're very stingy about ingredients. For example, I ordered a burrito. I don't get beans in my burrito, but I like cheese so I asked for a little extra cheese. They charged me $1 or something crazy like that for a few morsels of extra cheese. I kind of get it, but I didn't get a bunch of other ingredients that are included. To me, that's just stingy. 

Anyway, I don't love this place but I'll probably continue to go. Just order smart!
author: Mike W.

description:
Where are the decent Mexican restaurants in SF???

Absolutely, the worst Mexican fare that I've ever had. And, their staff are as unpleasant as the food. I've dined, (regrettably) in the restaurant and had delivery, (don't ask me why) and both were awful, they screwed up the order and the food was soggy and bland. Save yourself the trouble and go elsewhere.

Chipotle should throw these bums out and open a location here. Corporate but soooo much better.
author: Darryl D.

description:
At best this place has mediocre burritos. At worst, it is by far the worst burrito I have ever had; absolutely flavorless. I find that I roll the dice out of convenience, but given the choice, there are infinitely better options in the city.

I have kept those feelings to myself for 5 years because, really, it was just a cheap burrito. These guys totally swindled me last night. I ordered a burrito, and after an hour and a half I called to see what was up. The woman over the phone flat out LIED to me saying the driver was on the way and would be there within 10 minutes. I call back after 15 minutes and find out that not only has the driver not left, but THEY NEVER MADE THE BURRITO IN THE FIRST PLACE.

I assumed the low rating was on account of their burritos not being all that amazing and SF folk being burrito snobs. I then dug into the reviews and found that they have a history of not delivering food. I have contacted grubhub to let them know, but who knows if that will pan out.

If you can't deliver, then don't offer it. Also, not a great business strategy to lie to your customer and then continue not to deliver. That is just an asshole move whether or not you are a business.
author: Liz C.

description: This is my first time order this for delivery and it's not a great place cause I order 2 grilled steak burrito and it's too dry and not enough flavor.
author: Yvonne H.

description: I really don't know why this place has such low reviews :( it makes me kind of sad! Their carnitas tacos have tons of pork and are sooo good. Better than El Farlito.
author: Michelle E.

description:
Chorizo or bust! If you like wet burritos and chorizo id say give this place a shot. 

The chorizo is cooked fresh, and then pre-paired with all the fixings including a choice of tortilla, i get the spinach tortilla, beans, rice inside then smothered in sauce. Its topped with sour cream, guacamole  and cheese. The sauce they use has a little tang to it, a smooth mild flavor. It pairs nice with their hot sauce on top, which is also included. The chorizo is spiced nicely, but not over the top. It isnt to greasy like chorizo can be. The overall flavor is good of this creation; seasoned nicely, a good tang from the lime, salted correctly, and the right amount of food. I suspect the wet sauce is what adds the richness of flavor and depth of character. Would it not be for the wet sauce it probably wouldnt be as good, it just brings it all together.

This is a classic mexican joint that has the meet pre-cooked (other than the chorizo wich is cooked to order) and why i never order anything other than the chorizo. Of course things like marinated pork in green sauce and what-have-you need to be pre made, i get that, but because of this i find its better to order things that are cooked fresh and not from the hot warmers. This is a general statement about all mexican joints with warmers. 

I have noticed if you dont watch them make the food, they have a tendency to get things wrong, like giving me a regular tortilla instead of a spinach one. So make sure your clear, patient, and pay attention when they start your order. 

I can see how people may think they are rude, but lets be honest, if you are rude first why would you expect them to be super nice. Gotta put out what you want to recive back.

All and all, its a decent spot for a wet burrito with chorizo. If you order anything else, with the exception of their veggie items, which are all good, i wouldn't expect anything to rave about. I have had way better super burritos so these are not really worth mentioning here. 

3 stars for the chorizo wet burrito. 

2 stars over all. The bathroom is gross, so unless your a dude, hold it in. Not so friendly, but not so rude, just kinda bla.
author: Zaque E.

description:
I have been craving for a burrito for awhile now and thought to give this place a shot. Boy was i wrong. Outside appearance was ehh okay if you ignore the graffiti on the windows and a badly handwritten, "Fresh orange juice" sign on the window. I should have taken all the flies flying around the restaurant as a sign telling me not to go any further but i went to other places that looks a bit similar and their food tasted amazing but this time i was wrong. 

The salsas they had was bland and had no taste but tomatoes soaking in water, The chips tasted a bit weird (maybe organic corn? idk) but what turned me off was the burrito i ordered. The lettuce was wet, the steak had no flavor and was dry. Some of the steak was actually hard as well!

not going back here anymore.
author: Kayy L.

description:
I'm really shocked to see that this place only has 2.5 stars! My girlfriend and I eat here and order delivery from here all the time. It isn't the BEST Mexican food we've ever had in our lives or anything, but it's always delicious! They're open pretty late so they also always come through in the clutch after late nights out. And the people working there are always nice to us. 

We love it! We get the chile relleno, the super veggie burrito, and the enchiladas. All are scrumptious.
author: Jocelyn G.

description:
Update: I called to tell them this and the man on the phone just said "oh" over and over again. I said "This is when you should be saying I'm sorry and not Oh." And he said "oh". I confirmed that he understood english and he asked me how i paid and if I wanted a refund. I said, "No, I want you to apologize." And he never did!!! He claimed there was no manager there. NOW I am asking for my money back.

I ordered dinner tonight via GrubHub at 7:30 and it was delivered at 8:45, 75 minutes after the order (30min longer than estimated) and the food was cold. Not as in "sat out on the counter and started to cool down a bit" - the food was literally cold and soggy. The tacos completely fell apart b/c the torillas got so soggy and the burrito was cold all the way through. If you can't deliver hot (even warm) food 1 mile away in a timely manner, then don't offer delivery. Meanwhile, the food was tasty (albeit cold).
author: Kendell H.

description:
Ever since I moved here to the Bay area, I have been eating at a larger amount of taqueria's since they are SO good here! I was however a bit disappointed by this one. It's mediocre at best, but compared to others in the area, this one doesn't have anything special about it unfortunately.

If you are in this area of town and are really craving a taco or burrito, then by all means, stop in, it's alright and will satisfy your hunger. Prices are comparable to other taqueria's, however the staff isn't very friendly. I've been here twice and they don't greet you as you come in (come on now, at least smile, I am giving you my money and you a reason to continue operating). The food also seems to have been sitting out for a while since all the sauces, ingredients are in metal (heating) canisters with a thin film on top where you can tell the sauce with meat/veggies hasn't been stirred in a while. I just try to stick to the non-meat items (even though I'm not vegetarian and have a tough tummy) so I don't feel sick later. The veggie burrito for less than $5 with rice, beans, cheese, salsa is an awesome deal, I'd recommend getting that!

They do give you a good amount of food for the price though. The regular burrito's are hefty and won't leave you feeling hungry. They do take credit cards and are open late so that's a plus, so stop in if you're hungry...just don't expect awesome service, lol.
author: Akvile D.

description:
A little hard to order because it doesn't seem like the servers can hear you, but otherwise, pretty good for a drunken late-night snack.  I got the super nachos with chorizo--pretty darn tasty.  Even tasty the next morning :)  

Not a place that you HAVE to try, but it's a good place to have a snack if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Jackie H.

description: I was craving burrito and I was right next door at noc noc. I didn't have time to yelp this place or I wouldn't of ordered from here. I got home looked at the bad yelp reviews and was scared to eat my burrito...It wasn't bad and thank god not super soggy. The flavor of my pork was good and the salsa I grabbed from the salsa bar was pretty good too. I got the avocado sauce and the pico De Gallo. I don't think I would go out of my way because it was just ok not a true mission street burrito...Oh and too expensive! almost $8 for super burrito no chips!!
author: Karen T.

description:
$24 charged to my card, 2 1/2 hours later still no food. I called a second time and was told it will be 1 more hour. My guests are gone. The movie is over. I'm $24 poorer and still hungry.

They say can't refund my money (I think they just don't understand me.) Why must my spanish suck soo bad???! Ugh. Can someone tell me how to get my money back. I ordered online through @yelp??!!

 Damn, I was really craving a burrito too.

I knew Mexican delivery was too good to be true. FML!
author: Heysoos R.

description: All of these bad reviews just seem like one offs to me. So here is a good review for you. Went in last night to grab a quick burrito with some friends and everyone enjoyed it. I went with my trusted bean and cheese burrito which was delicious alone, but the green salsa they have was seriously delicious and made every bite super tasty. If I ever find myself back in Lower Haight craving a burrito, that will be my first stop. 1 star off for not having any cerveza! That would have perfected the meal.
author: Jane F.

description: For what it is...a quick and easy Mexican spot, does not deserve the rating it has.  It's basic and flavorful. I always get the three crispy tacos and I'm never disappointed. Full of meat, beans, cheese sour cream, guac. Nothing you wouldn't expect. Why this place is rated so low, I don't understand. It's way better than rancho on divis. Way better. They're always nice, ask how the night is going and double check on making sure what's in your order.  Hope someone else sees where I'm coming from.
author: Taylor C.

description: I don't get many things here- but the super shrimp quesadilla is to die for! Also, it's super messy so have plenty of napkins or a fork and knife
author: Apryl S.

description:
Seriously, this is an excellent joint in the lower Haight. I've come here a variety of
times in a variety of states (hungry, late at night, mildly hungover, etc.) and the food is quick, fresh and always hits the spot. 

I usually stick to the tacos or the super quesadilla (with either steak, al pastor, chicken, etc.) and all are lipsmackingly delicious. The quesadilla is especially generously sized -- I have a hearty appetite and have yet to finish one in one sitting (speaking as someone who can usually demolish a burrito in no time flat).

Great for a cheap, easy meal or post-drinks late night snack with friends -- my friends in the Mission actually prefer to come here vs. the standard Mission taquerias, which speaks volumes.
author: lauren c.

description:
I hate and love this place just as I hate and love myself after going here. I know there's better food to be had, but it's close and the employees are nice. 

I almost want to give this place 4 stars for showing a Monterrey-Tigres LigaMX match during the World Series.  Love me some decent burritos, love me some Herc Gomez.
author: Loren K.

description:
Lower Haight needs a good taqueria, especially considering how many bars are in the area. Unfortunately, this place is not it. The ingredients are low quality and all the fillings (lettuce, onions, tomatoes, etc.) look dilapidated. Nothing is warmed much at all. Eat within a minute or two or everything will be cold. Bleh.

But, my NUMBER ONE reason for disliking this place is their gross hygiene habits. More than once I have seen employees take cash and make change while wearing gloves and then turn around and make burritos without changing their gloves. I have seen them pick up crap from the floor with their gloves on and go one to make food. Once, the employee making my burrito had so much brown stuff on his gloves, (nastiness from money or the counter top) I cancelled my order. 

Gloves should always be removed when using the register. Nasty. Do not eat here until they make a greater commitment to hygiene.
author: Melissa A.

description: I love this place. I live a block away and would choose them over the snobby hipsters on divis any day. Is it perfect? No. Is it delicious? Hell yea. Don't believe me? Try the chicken mole burrito. I ask for no beans (the don't agree with me) and always get extra meat. They're always happy to make anything any way you want it. As for the staff, give em a smile and they will always warm up and chat. I'm pretty sure they're conditioned to being a little cold after serving so many drunk people at 1AM over the years.
author: L K.

description:
With all the amazing Mexican restaurants in this city, this place is just not worth it.

I ordered the Meat Super Quesadilla which comes with sour cream and guacamole in addition to the standard meat, cheese, and salsa. Little did I realize they would actually cook the sour cream and guacamole into the quesadilla, leaving me with a to-go order that was absolutely soaked through with liquid sour cream. If that's what you're into, great. But as someone who likes their quesadillas with a grilled tortilla that you can actually pick up with your hands, this was confusing and kinda gross. Also, the "guacamole" consisted of full quarter slices of underripe avocado which had a consistency similar to a half-baked potato. 

Upside is free chips and salsa with your order, and it's centrally located near the bars in Lower Haight.
author: Malaika D.

description:
Come on, two prawns in the whole prawn burrito?! 

This is kinda bland less than average Mexican food.
author: Jessica J.

description:
I placed an order for 2 burritos thru eat24 online and was given the default time estimate of 75 mins. I contacted them twice at the 80 minute mark and the 100 minute mark and was told that "the driver is on the way" and "only a few more minutes". At the 2 hour mark, I inquired about the order yet again and was told the driver was not able to be contacted.

Over 2 hours later, it was getting too ridiculous and I had to cancel my order and scrounge for food late in the night. Around the 2.5 hour mark, the delivery guy finally arrived and had to be told that the order had be canceled. 

NO BUENO.
author: Kim L.

description: Super burrito is good. Atmosphere isn't incredible. The food doesn't match the look which is a little outdated. Not to dawg it because the look isn't a good way to tell if the food is amazing or not. The food out exceeds any downfall.
author: Matthew F.

description:
People are hella trippin. 

This place has excellent tacos and offers free chips, free roasted jalapeños, verde salsa with avocado in it, spicy roasted tomato salsa, pico de gallo, big portions, excellent carnitas and chicken chili verde. The burritos I've ordered here I've gotten exactly to my specifications which includes some extra stuff I like on there (cilantro and onions), every time. All their meat is prepared fresh (you can often see them cooking it in the kitchen). The people aren't always smiling but I think that's because they have to deal with stuck up hipster stoners all day. When I'm friendly, they're friendly. What more do you want from a taqueria? If you want organic tofu and smiling people go to Little Chihuahua and stand in line for 30 minutes. 

Order a taco and be surprised. This is my go-to joint in the hood. And open late. 

If you:

- ordered mexican food for delivery,
- watched someone put the wrong kind of beans in your burrito right in front of you without saying anything,
- are basing your review of a taqueria on a veggie burrito,
- are basing a review of a taqueria on only burritos, 
- ordered a prawn quesadilla
- are basing your review of a taqueria on the service
- paid for chips,
or
- called someone a Burrito Nazi,

then, well, I'm sorry to say that you are hereby fired from the Bay Area.
author: Nathan H.

description:
It's gotta be hard to eff up a burrito so fantastically, but Estrella Taqueria has managed to pull it off. 

I've been there a few times, thinking maybe there was a rogue cook in the kitchen that was responsible for the blandest burrito I've ever had. It doesn't seem to be the case; their burritos are consistently terrible. 

The last (and final) time I went in, I ordered a super veggie burrito with refried beans. What I got was a watery disaster consisting of pinto (not refried) beans, rice, crappy salsa, and not much else (like sour cream and guacamole, which was supposed to be in there). I know the lady heard me request refried beans because I did it twice, so she either didn't write it down, or she just thought she wouldn't tell me there were no refried beans and then hope I wouldn't notice. 

Anyway! Pretty obvious why it's always empty in there. I'm happy to give Cu Co's (another taqueria just down the street) my business. Cu Co's food is just as good as their attitude.
author: Angela K.

description: Maybe this place is doable in person, but they are THE WORST for delivery. I ordered through Eat24. I wanted a super quesadilla - they brought a quesadilla with a tiny amount of cheese, and little burnt crusts of meat. No other ingredients. I got a super burrito that I ordered without rice, and it arrives with mostly rice - 75% and barely any other ingredients. Eat 24 contacted the restaurant and they did not want to refund me and stated that I was lying and they did not put rice in the burrito. I had to email pictures to Eat 24 to prove it and it took over 30 minutes to resolve. Never again! They are terrible at food prep and they are liars on top of it!
author: Maria D.

description:
ordered delivery...yes, delivery...we were already in for the night and both craved Mexican so our only option was this place...
We should have ordered a pizza.
we should have ordered sushi..
even (blech) Indian ...
it might have been better.

I got 2 tacos.  One had literally 3 small shrimp (prawns? um, no) on it and some lettuce and was so bland that I had to use my own hot salsa rather than the bland crap they sent. 
The other was so salty that I was up 3 times in the middle of the night just to chug water.
The tortillas tasted super stale.

My friend got a burrito, bland... and some tacos...again, bland.

We learned our lesson.  Next time we will put on clothes and go out to get our Mexican fix.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Absolutely one of the saddest taqueria experiences of my San Francisco life. Ordering burritos online is a bit of an anomaly. We order pizza, Chinese food or Indian, but very rarely are there burrito delivery services. I guess Grub Hub's advertisement depicting two bros high-fiving and exclaming, "I just ordered a burrito for delivery!" really got to me.

Regardless, I placed my order for 2 on Grub Hub. The delivery was pretty standard and they met the estimated delivery time with no problem. However, after the driver had left, I realized that they did not give me the chips and guacamole that I ordered. In fact, I received zero tortilla chips, even though I had ordered a side of salsa. (I think any upstanding taqueria should give you chips with your order, but that's besides the point.)

I circumvented the Grub Hub website and contacted the restaurant directly. I was told the driver was going to be contacted with my first call. 20 minutes pass. I call again. It will be another 20 minutes. 40 minutes pass. I call again and I am told that they are "very busy" to which I reply that it is unacceptable to not have my paid-for item either reimbursed or delivered. I was given an, "Okay," and hung up on.

Meanwhile, I had already finished eating my sub-standard quesadilla and in all honesty, was arguing for the sake of retribution-- I didn't really want their poor quality guac.

Thankfully, Grub Hub took it upon themselves to reverse the charge and give me free credit for a future order. (Kudos!) I just know that I WON'T be spending it here.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Less for more.

Fed might be keeping interest rates low but burrito inflation is well under way. Rarely find a regular one for less than $6 these days.

There are exceptions. Like Estrella's $5.70 tofu ranchero burrito

Woman helping me did not share my enthusiasm. Didn't seem happy to be there or happy to see me. We got straight to business.

Despite her lukewarm attitude she put together a balanced and quite delicious combo of the above plus black beans and salsa in a wheat tortilla.

Spent less for an arguably healthier meal. That's a fiscal policy I can get behind.
author: Jason B.

description:
Well, after ordering delivery from here for a long time, here's what I have to say now that I'm no longer going to be coming here anymore. Their food is the epitome of the word "mediocre". And that's only if you order like a few hours after they open. If you order delivery from this place past 5-6 PM, you done fucked up. Their nachos sucks(chips always soggy, can't even eat it). Their burritos are occasionally okay.. most of the time soggy. For their meat plates, they're really stingy with how much meat they give. I expect a 10 dollar meal to come with AT LEAST 1/4 the plate of meat, but nah.. It comes with less meat than the size of the palm of your hand.

For delivery time, they're usually faster than their ETA.
author: Jason A.

description: I just had a crap breakfast burrito. It seemed like the cook did not know what goes on their own burrito and kept asking me what to put on it. By the end it was a disgusting monstrosity. 2 breakfast burritos and chips 17$!!  Rip!
author: Morgan H.

description: Don't eat here, these people are rude and very nasty. My order was all wrong and disgusting. When I called to tell them about it, they just argued and told me I was wrong when the order didn't match up to my receipt at all. I wish I had read the reviews first.
author: LaToya H.

description: I was looking for good Mexican food in the city and this place was great! Food was delivered before its ETA and so delicious! I ordered the nachos which were fully loaded and had a bit of a kick and my boyfriend ordered the super quesidilla  which he was very pleased with! Highly recommended and we will definitely order from here again!
author: JessLeigh A.

description:
Ordered delivery from here and... I will never do that. 

Food was late, drink was leaking all over, soggy burrito had finger length chicken bone in it, agua fresca had a live bug swimming in it. Gross.
author: Peter N.

description: Horrible!! They microwaved my rolled tacos which made them soggy, found a hair and a chuck of avocado skin in the guac!
author: Cat D.

description: Came here on a whim when everything else was closed & the tacos were delicious. Super fresh & simple. No complaints!
author: Chelsea M.

description: Don't expect much. I mean, there are so many other great Mexican restaurants in San Francisco, no need to come to the Lower Haight for this place. If you live in the area, and you're too lazy to walk down to the Castro, or not wanting to walk up to Little Chihuahua  come here. If you're drinking in the neighborhood, it could fill you up for the time being.
author: Cody M.

description: Good not great food for a great price.  I appreciated the entire vegetarian section of the menu. The refried beans were vegetarian! A first. :) jarritos and mexican coke were also on sale. I got two tacos and could make them vegan. Friend got the enchiladas- said they were amazing! Chips also included in the meal.
author: Sofía A.

description: The food is fast and cheap, as other reviewers have said.  At least sort of.  Chips and salsa puts one back $2.90, which is okay, but it isn't like they have a salsa bar.  They have mild or hot as options.  Also, it wasn't actually explained that chips cost extra. . .
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Pretty good food. Not bad at all. First time here ordered delivery. On time. Ordered super burrito but got a regular burrito. Chicken quesodilla with extra lechuga was a asada quesodilla NO lettuce when it got there.. Three stars for mixed order.. But if they deliver late I will take it when I'm looking for late taqueria eats in the mission..

Wrong order aside, would have been four star service/taq food late delivery 



(I was just enjoying the left overs and realized I had not  finished posting this review.. Granted im a Lil baked but FIVE STARS!! MMMMMM)
author: Rob D.

description: No bueno. The food is barely tolerable and the people who work there seem unable to give less of a faaa.
author: Maryam M.

description: I had food delivered from Eat24 last night and it was absolutely disgusting. Mostly due to the fact that it wasn't even remotely warm by the time to was delivered and took them over 90min to deliver.  Don't even get me started on the dark brown oxidize guacamole they had the nerve to serve.  The chips were cold and tasted like rancid oil.   I've had better from 4th world countries I've visited.  The spicy chicken taco, although cold was their only redeeming factor.   I can't attest to the dinning in experience.
author: Eric C.

description:
They have decent drunk food. 

The chicken quesadilla surely hit the spot when I was hungry at 1AM.
author: Benny H.

description:
There is really nothing extraordinary about this place, but there is also nothing really bad about it. I have definitely been to better taquerias but Estrella is good enough to keep coming back to when I want something convenient and fast. I have tried a few different burritos and they are all okay, with the pollo being the best option I have had here and the carnitas being the least impressive. The sopes are also nothing to write home about, but they make a really good nachos plate.

My wife always wants crunchy tacos, which not all taquerias have, but they have them here. They also accept credit cards which is appreciated
author: Frank J.

description: Your "establishment" is a complete joke. My food NEVER got delivered and the help behind the phone was a complete joke too. Hope this place closes down
author: Ryan V.

description: Terrible.  As the other reviews say - delivery takes 2 hours minimum, you will be lucky if you get all of your order, and to top it off, the food is repulsive.  You couldn't pay me to eat here again.
author: Oleg O.

description: Meat quesadilla simply taa diee forrr. Was very tasty, couldn't slow down... had to eat it fast fast fast... not that it was bad... but because it was so... (you guessed it) tasty. came with chips that were good too. located in good area with other food places and shops.
author: Drawing G.

description:
3.5+*--just not 4...

I ordered a vegan burrito, she knew what I wanted, it was quickly made and it tasted good. The spot just really needs to get cleaned up, as well as the bad vibe. I think people's bad reviews are more based on feeling, unless you ordered prawn...I mean, whatever, that's YOUR deal, girl.

I've been burned a few times on burritos in this town, which is strange because before I moved here I only had great ones. My luck ran out. I was the only person at this spot, and I walked by the most dismal taqueria a few minutes later, that place that was tasteless and took forever, was packed. People and their vibe in the restaurant world. So much more to do with the space and attitudes of the workers than the food itself, seems to me.

I think everyone would raise their reviews by a star if they were served in basically the same way with this grub at another spot that they dig more. Too many harsh words for this place.
author: Mike L.

description:
This is one sloppy ass wrapped burrito. But whatever. The al pastor is truly flavorful and delicious. Plus, you can get your burrito spicy! (and it really is spicy)

I also tried the carne asada a couple times here, and it was only okay. And they don't heat it up on the grill like they do the al pastor. Also, the salsa's behind the counter so you can't fill up your own 8 little plastic cups :(

Good Mexican soda selection and pretty fast delivery (granted I live 4 blocks away). 

Four stars for al pastor, but really two stars for everything else. Oh and don't take your burrito out of the foil or it'll spill out over your plate.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
I've ordered here for delivery a few times and was happy. Not the case this last time. Bottom line was everything was cold when it arrived at my home 5 blks away from the restaurant. 
Quesadilla was hard with cold cheese. Nachos where fused under the now cold toppings and very soggy from sitting under the foil that was supposed to keep them warm. 
If you have to order from here stick to burritos. That was the only item that was still edible by delivery. Seems its the only thing on the extensive menu they can do right.
author: Justin S.

description:
fast delivery. not oily nachos. 
requested few specifications- seperate sauces on nachos, extra lettuce, 3 extra green salsa, two utensils, and blackbean substitution. 

everything was done as requested and delivered within an hour. 
food was great, beef was tender and juicy, and will order again! 
burrito was not as big as it looks. it wasnt big enough for a 29yr male for dinner. 

if you online order, i suggest to call to confirm any specifications.
author: Jinn C.

description:
I find that sometimes I lose a functioning definition of regret.

Then I order a carne asada burrito as big as a dwarf's (1) thigh and pour Tapatio all over it and bring out pictures of failed relationships and put on radiohead and just wake up the next morning smeared with sour cream and grains of rice and the place smells of taco sauce and it's all good.

(1) Or small person-- I confess to be unsure of the correct nomenclature.    My gut told me midget was out.   I think the guy on Game of Thrones calls himself a dwarf.
author: Brill S.

description: Dont buy into the delivery bullshit on yelp. This place is a joke! But it ain't funny! Subpar employees that don't know anything about customer service. I think they went to I don't give a fuck university. Not a good look for all involved.  They'll mock you out loud on the phone in Spanglish, all the while taking your credit card number. I ended up canceling my order after the fool on the phone told me to text the "driver" 415 2641089. This place needs to crawl back in the hole in the wall. FUCK THEM!!!!
author: Jen M.

description:
2 words: chicken mole

Put it in anything and it will be amazing. I probably go here once a day - love this place. Staff is incredibly courteous, food is cheap and super bomb. My go to is the chicken mole California burrito.
author: Ben B.

description: I would never order from this place ever again. I didn't get what I asked for and the lady wanted to argue about it. My burrito was dry I asked for prawns and extra sour cream got neither.  How do you make a hard enchilada?!!! The chips were stale as well.  I should have read some of the reviews before ordering.
author: Shavonn D.

description:
This place is terrible. Low quality meat, not very tasty either. The only redeeming quality is that their salsa is pretty good. Its sadly the only real mexican food in lower haight and its terrible. I will never go there again.

Best bet is to walk a few blocks down to Church and Duboce and go to El Castillito. Those guys know how to do it. http://www.yelp.com/biz/el-castillito-san-francisco-2
author: Jake L.

description:
I love this place, one of my favs in town. The food is basic but delicious, fast, and cheap. I typically get the tostada salad with steak, a fruit punch Jarritos, and flan; yum.

The servers are always really nice. They deliver too!
author: Jennifer T.

description: I come here all the time because it's close to home.  "It'll do" is the order of the day at Estrella.  They have big pots steaming away on the stove, so at least we know some of the ingredients are prepared in-house.  If you are unlucky enough to get the somewhat trashy lady when you order your food (trust me, you'll know her when you see her), be prepared to remind her what you ordered several times throughout the process and be handed an under-meated, over-riced burrito at the end of it.  Everyone else who works here is friendly and does the best they can with mediocre ingredients.
author: Josh B.

description:
I read the reviews, I usually don't let others form my opinion, but from here on I WILL!  Go YELP!
Ordered Prawn Quesadilla, 3 pieces of shrimp and cheese in the entire Quesadilla, I kid you not!  Husbands taco, was layered, he had to eat it with a fork and knife.  Was so disappointed.  I really wanted to like them, they were so friendly, very clean behind the counter, CHEAP and convenient for us.  Maybe next time we will give it another try.
author: Kristie H.

description: Pretty damn good mexican food. the fish tacos were off the hook. .  the  enchilada platter awesome.
author: Jorge O.

description: I ordered for delivery, it was late and cold. The tacis where forgettable and the burrito was dry, small and boring.
author: Amy S.

description: Mediocre food and a small menu. No salsa bar (actually there is one, but they have only two different salsas). The place feels really cheap and low end. Watch out if you're ordering hot salsa in your tacos or burritos, it's really hot.
author: Igor P.

description:
Most second chances in my life have backfired miserably.

Take for example when I decided to give KITT and Michael Knight a second chance when they remade Knight Rider.  

Oooff..what a shitter.

And I am quite certain that the Smurfs remake is going to be a big pile of steamy blue poop as well.  

So against my better judgment I walked into Estrella knowing that La Carreta's was pretty bad.  

I gotta say, that while I didn't have a burrito, the tacos were delicious.  

Estrella is cleaner and you can tell that they take more pride in their food.  

In the back I could see whole chickens being stewed next to a huge pork shoulder simmering in some sauce.  

I also appreciate any place that is trying to win back business.  

Estrella, when I was there, was giving away free sodas with any food purchase and they were really trying to make a good impression.  

All in all, so far, a good addition to the lower haight food scene and a very bad addition to my ever expanding ass.

Reconciled.
author: Archie R.

description: Open late, does the trick but wouldn't necc go there with lots of other options available. That being said the super carnitas taco, while a little bland hit the drunk spot just fine.
author: Misha T.

description: My friend & I ordered the torta. She ordered the ham & I ordered Cubana. When they yelled out "torta," i immediately grabbed it because I ordered before my friend did. However, it was the ham torta. Dissatisfied with the contents inside, I already ate half of it. Luckily, my friend grabbed the Cubana torta, so we ended up splitting it, which was totally fine. The ham was "blah" as the best way I can describe it. the bread was stale, avocados seemed fresh, the ham was nothing special by any means. The Cubana looked heftier with much more contents, sausage, egg, ham, and some kind of meat patty. The bread tasted better on the Cubana because it had butter on the inside halves of the sandwich. Everything was edible, but mediocre except for the meat patty. I could barely bite into it. I pulled it out and tried biting a piece off, but I had such a difficult time, I decided to give up on the meat patty. One torta and a drink costed me $14.41!!! OMG, for mexican food????!!! $14.41 wouldn't be terrible if the food actually tasted good, but it wasn't. My other friend had a burrito, and she said it was good, but she just finished a 7 mile run at Bay to Breakers. I like a lot of mom & pop shops, but I doubt I can return here. Also, the bathroom was extremely filthy. The tables were gross too...and this was after one of the employees wiped it in front of our eyes. Oh, and there are flies flying around everywhere. Apologies for leaving a bad review.
author: Mia X.

description: Two hours later and my food hasn't been delivered... and they aren't answering their phone... and their voicemail is full... and now I'm eating PBJ.
author: David H.

description: As a to-go burrito joint, I like this place. I usually stick with the basic veggie burrito but it's been consistently good for a great price. I like the salsa and the rice they use, the place is clean, and everyone working there has been pleasant each time I go. Moving my stars from 3 to 4.
author: Ben C.

description: A totally serviceable buritto shop. Much better than la caretta. In the early days , the menu was similar, but sometime recently they switched to a newer selection of goods. Their burittos aren't going to beat papalote or anything, but they will hit the spot. Especially their cochinita pibil. Yum.
author: Tom H.

description: never order from here. they are very rude and they lie. i waited over 90 mins for my order and never got it. they stated that they called me to get my food and i have phone records to prove that they never called. they refused to redeliver and didn't apologize for the inconvenience. they wasted my time!!!!!!
author: Camillah T.

description:
I was so excited when I saw that a new taqueria opened here. I really wanted another good place to get Mexican food in my neighborhood....unfortunately it's not this place. 

I got a super carne asada burrito for $10 (with tip). I took it to my favorite neighborhood bar and dug right in, only to discover I was eating the most bland burrito I have ever had. There was so little flavor that I could actually taste the lettuce more than anything else in it...I didn't even know it was possible for a burrito to have absolutely no flavor at all. I wish it had been overly salty like the carnitas burrito Boris C. got. I wondered if maybe my taste buds were off...but my two other friends that tried the burrito with me said the same thing. It tasted as if they boiled plain beef, then rinsed it, then boiled it again...that's the only way I can think that they drained so much flavor from it.  Absolutely no flavor at all.

I feel bad writing this, because I really want this place to be good, and succeed; but unless they realize that their food is just not good, it won't happen. They have a good Veggie menu, so I will probably go back once more, and give them one more chance and hope they improved....because I'm really not kidding (I wish I was) when I say, that was the most bland, most un-flavorful thing I have ever eaten.
author: Peter C.

description:
Standard run of the mill taqueria. Nothing special stood out.

Not the best but not bad either
author: Lisa W.

description:
It is opened late. That's nice. They are nice. That's nice. I fed four drunk people for 30 dollars. That's nice. The salsa is very hot. That's nice. 

But unfortunately the actual food, is, well, sort of revolting. In the best possible way though. But, on New Year's Eve, El Farolito was closed, and you were not. And for that, I say, thank you.

Otherwise, they put lettuce in the burritos. I thought Ashton Kutcher was going to pop out and yell, "DUUUUUUUUUUDDDDDDEEEE!" But no. They simply put lettuce in the burritos.
author: Sir M.

description:
La Carreta's replacement is . . . almost the same as La Carreta.  That's right; almost everything's the same.  Except it's a little more expensive now, which is one of the reasons it gets fewer stars than its equally depressing predecessor.  And they've managed to make the food even blander, somehow.

Although the people who work here are very nice, I must issue a

GRATUITOUS-MEAT ALERT.

There's a vegetarian section of the menu, which should mean that they care about their vegetarian customers' vegetarianism.  I had the super veggie burrito, but when I asked the burrito maker whether they use lard in their refried beans, he said they do.  I had to ask, which means that if I hadn't I would have eaten a non-vegetarian vegetarian burrito without being warned about this first.  Bad news.
author: John S.

description: I ordered the wet vegetarian burrito. It came with chips for $8.50 and was large. I liked the sauces but without them the burrito itself probably would have been kind of one-flavor. But, I was hungry, the staff were nice and it hit the spot.
author: Robert T.

description: First time ordering delivery from this restaurant. First problem, food arrived cold. Second problem, the order was incorrect. They were missing items that I paid for. I called the restaurant to make sure my missing items were going to be either delivered or refunded. The staff said they would re-deliver the items within 30 minutes. Nobody arrived, I called the restaurant and nobody answered. Poor customer service. Will not consider ordering here again.
author: Aaron E.

description:
Skip this place.

The burrito was passable, though rather salty. The hair in the burrito was neither passable nor salty. Just narsty.

Not a particularly good taqueria, regardless of whether or not you like hair in your burrito. And not one of the better food choices in this neighborhood, which is otherwise full of great bars and eateries.
author: Mark R.

description: I ordered food from Estrella through delivery.com (a service they've signed up for) and after waiting an hour and 10 minutes  I rang them asking when our 2 burritos will be delivered.  They put me on hold for 9 minutes before telling me they didn't know and will call me back.  I asked if they have my number but the lady hung up on me.  Guess what, she never called back.  I rang 10+x before they picked up.  They told me they still didn't know when the food will be delivered and I needed to call the driver.  I rang Carlos the driver he was 6 mins from my house and told me it'd be another 30 mins before he could deliver.  Mind you, that the total delivery time is now at TWO HOURS AND THIRTY MINUTES and  the restaurant is 15 blocks from my house.  I called to cancel my order and they told me they couldn't help and I needed to call delivery.com myself.  Honestly - how are these people in business.  Ruined our night unfortunately...
author: Chalene C.

description:
This place is the definition of hit or miss.

I have had food from here that is amazing, but I have ordered the same item and barley been able to eat. It seems like there is absolutely no consistency in the quality of the food, even when it is the same person making it!

However, its cheap, and open late.
author: Meowy C.

description: Good, cheapish Mexican. Friendly staff. Will be back.
author: Stu T.

description: I ordered a super burrito, carne asada. It was bland. I can't say it was bad because it had no discernible flavor. The service was nice and polite, but incapable of wrapping a burrito. I watched as he tucked the sides and then rolled. Somewhere in the middle he gave up and just sort of smashed it together. I was left with a burrito that lost all semblance of structural integrity about one third of the way through. Definitely a place to pass by.
author: Richard W.

description: They are over two hours late! This is the second time this happens. First time, they got a pass because I liked the food. This time, I pledge not to ever give them my business again.
author: Michelle V.

description:
I had the tofu ranchero burrito.  It was okay, but nothing amazing.  The burrito overall was pretty soggy and relatively bland.

Hoping that things turn around.  I like that the place is vegetarian-friendly.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Pretty generic as far as Mexican food goes.

9 times out of 10, I'd be going to the Mission if I wanted more legit Mexican food, but I was watching football at Mad Dogs and thought I'd try the place out. For the set up and quality of food, the prices were way too high. When the meat is precooked and left in a warmer for how ever many hours, I'd prefer not to spend over 8 bucks for a burrito. Also, they call wet burritos a "Star" burrito here, never heard that before but whatever.

When I first ordered my burrito, I apparently got the newest trainee because she had no idea where anything was and looked completely lost. After she finally put my burrito together, the manager came out and yelled at her about how it was made wrong. I just thought, "How do you incorrectly make a burrito? It's not like she threw meat and cheese into a tortilla and then a sandwich suddenly appeared." 

Much to my chagrin, they threw that burrito in the trash and she made another. What was the difference you might ask? She microwaved the second one prior to putting the guacamole on. If I had known my burrito was going to be microwaved with precooked meat, I'd have been more than willing to miss a few more minutes of the game and walk somewhere else.

I finally got my burrito, made it back to the bar, and started to dig in. As I said, it was generic and without any real flavor or substance to it. Estrella is the kind of Mexican food spot you go to when you've just left the bars, it's 2 am, and you're so trashed that you can't tell the difference between McDonalds and Burma Superstar. It's enough to fill you up even if you can't taste a thing.
author: Anthony C.

description: Stopped by here for a burrito one day. The staff was great and were ok with special requests. I ordered bean and cheese burrito with half re fried and half black bean and onions. The food was decent but not the most amazing burrito I've ever had. I would stop by here again if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Stephanie T.

description: My boyfriend and I saw this place on grubhub.com and ordered for delivery. Our estimated time for delivery was 9:24pm. At 10:04pm we tried calling the place, no answer. Tried again, got an answering machine. Tried one last time, the driver is on his way. Still haven't gotten the food yet, but just because of the wait, we'll probably never order here again. They're also only a mile away from us so no excuse.
author: Vivian V.

description: Delivery took over two hours. The food is decent and if you want Mexican food past 10pm you don't have a ton of options, but honestly you're better off not bothering.
author: Tito T.

description:
Love this place.

Great burritos, fair prices, and open late.

Their burritos are fantastic.

 Dunno what people on here expect from a fucking burrito.
author: Brendan M.

description: I placed an order over the phone and they never delivered it. I called back an hour later and they apologized and said it would be there in 5 minutes. 10 minutes later I called back and they stopped answering the phone. SHADY! Thank god I planned on paying with cash and never gave my credit card number!!!!!  It's now been two hours and I've lost hope.
author: streeterville c.

description: Went there last week and managed to complete an order.  However, in light of the absolute rudeness of the woman behind the counter, I immediately told them to cancel.   I don't need this poor level of service.  I'll not be back.
author: Anthony G.

description: My personal favorite Mexican joint in SF- their food is excellent, the place is spacious, and the employees are friendly. Their chips are also quite good compared to most. And they actually take credit cards. It sounds like most complaints are from their delivery, which I have never tried, so I cannot comment there.
author: Jim P.

description:
Came here after going to the Toronado and feeling pretty tipsy (and therefore hungry).

Ordered a carne asada taco and was deeply disappointed. Maybe it's because I've lived in San Diego where I practically breathed Mexican food, but what I ordered was very not bueno. The meat was dry and hard, and the tortilla was a little mushy. And yes, I took note of all this despite my then-state of mind. I'm so glad I stuck with my instincts and only ordered one taco.
author: Christina C.

description: The burritos here are amazing. I crave this place. They are open late and the staff is always friendly. Be careful though because the marinated chicken is spicy!! It's really good but just be she you like spicy food.
author: Marisa M.

description:
A definite improvement from the former restaurant.  Food is fresher and the staff is friendlier.   
Only complaint is on the beans having lard, as they should be vegetarian with veg oil added.
author: John C.

description: I love this place. It is super cheap and food is yummy. All meals come with chips and salsa. Open late. Takes credit cards.
author: Mia M.

description: Extremely disappointed by my experience. Was delivered the wrong order and was not offered any compensation, refund, or exchange. I spent a few minutes on the phone with someone who admitted that he'd read the order wrong and then he said, "Next time just call here and place an order" (I'd ordered via GrubHub). Yeah, not calling them again.
author: Kim K.

description: My order came 45 minutes later than the original time I was promised which was already a really long time. Basically a 2 hour wait for my order
author: David B.

description: The only thing i was satisfied with was that the guy took a delivery order 5 min before they closed... however that doesnt make up for the fact there was ONE prawn in my prawn quesadilla annnd when we ordered the fish tacos they didnt tell us they didnt have fish tacos that night. wth? they didnt charge us at least... the guy hardly spoke english. SO obnoxious. The food tastes alright... the carnitas were good but too salty. Also they didnt give us any lemon or lime wedges so now i have to go down the hall and hope i dont walk in on my roommate and the guy she brought home.
author: Caitlin G.

description: This place is so overpriced its ridiculous $2.70 for a taco??? Really?! I was so pissed I didn't even buy anything at 1am so u know I wanted something! My homegirl cracked up and we shared her high priced a$$ burrito which was nothing to write home about but enough to fill the void in your stomach. Bottom line is the stars are because they are open until 2am.
author: Niah N.

description: I live on this same street about 5 blocks away. Feelin a bit haggard and not in the mood to leave the house, I placed an order for delivery. The lady who answered the phone sounded very confused and I had to correct my order several times. She then told me I had to text her personal cell phone my address. That was weird.... An hour later (I mean ordered 2 burritos and live on the same street?) I called to check on my order. The gentleman who answered set the phone down to check on my order. I heard him and what I am guessing is his wife laughing about the customer who waited "un hora".
